RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 10, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,5 00, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRETCH THE TRUTH set a pressured pace and contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in determinedly and raced clear under the wire. GRAND FIBER contested the pace from the start, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch and just lasted for second. PROTA pressured the pace, raced in the three path on the turn, dug in from the head of the lane, finished well and just missed second. WIDGET FACTORY gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, eased outward leaving the turn and finished well. PRINCE OF FENTON chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. KUKULKAN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Stretch the Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,determinedly lane,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Kukulkan
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,3p turn,dug in lane,just missed 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ILIKEFUNSIZE took the lead on the chute and rated a clear pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, was steadily encouraged leaving the turn then taken in hand later yards. MALIBU YEARS engaged in close early chase, raced off the rail on the turn and settled for second best. SOMESUGARNSPICE veered outward and made contact with MAD SWANN leaving the gate then gave close early chase, was pinched back approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. The latter was bumped at the break then picked up the chase while lugging in early, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Ilikefunsize
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Five Hellions Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated clear,pressured 5/16,urged to mid-stretch,in hand late yrds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE FEBRUARY 5, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs .; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ THE REASON broke clear and angled to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure at the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the stretch. COACH RUBE ducked outward and hit the gate at the break then gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and dug in through the stretch to take second later yards. MANAROLA gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. FANCY HER UP chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. EMBERLY ducked in leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path and flattened in the lane. SECRET CASTLE gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. SILKY SERENA became anxious in the gate and was pinched back at the start, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Silky Serena
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious gate,pinched start,chased,5p turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIRECT THE CAT was hustled to the lead at the half mile pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure at the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the turn and was kept alert to draw off through the lane. NAVY BAND gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail, proved no match in the stretch but held well for second. RUNAWAY BEAUTY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail then dueled through the stretch for third. MITOLE CANDY gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, entered the stretch two deep and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. MAKANI chased the leaders through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn then flattened in the lane. YES TO LOVE broke a step slow, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. MARGARITA SUNSET gave chase then flattened in the three path on the turn. ANOTHER FINE JUBA was reluctant to load then took a brief lead leaving the gate, gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Direct the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead,rated pace,pressured1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 10, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOMO RON gave chase and raced close in the three path on the turn, dug in from the head of the lane to take over later yards and drew clear approaching the wire. ZIGGY MON chased the early pace toward the inside, was eased five wide through the turn then steadily improved to take second the final yards. STEVETHEVANDRIVER took the lead nearing the half mile pole and rated the early pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths but was met in later yards and flattened nearing the wire. BIG DADDY D R gave chase toward mid track, steadied off the heels of Barry Karafin Bets past the quarter pole, raced in the five path through the turn then finished evenly to pass rivals. BE BE BOP gave chase, raced in range of the lead at the rail on the turn then flattened later yards. FLAMING EAST chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. AW ITE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. BARRY KARAFIN BETS was shuffled back on the chute then gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Daddy D R
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,on heels past 1/4,5p turn,passed rivals,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Nomo Ron
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close 3p turn,up later yards,clear near wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CONNECTING FLIGHT raced with the early pace two deep, took the lead leaving the five eighths pole and repelled Marquet Classic from the seven sixteenths pole, dueled clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled while wavering paths in the lane. NELLY TOO saved ground off the pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced close at the rail on the far turn but steadied from tight quarters at the rail in later yards. THE MONEY MACHINE took the lead while tapering to the inside but was met into the first turn, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and ran evenly in the lane. HERECOMES SCARLETT rated close inside, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. RIA FORMOSA broke a step slow and raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and raced evenly in the lane. MARQUET CLASSIC stalked the pace from the three path, challenged approaching the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back off the rail midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. JERSEY COAST saved ground and showed little response. ECLIPTICALS SHORTY was eased after a half mile. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Connecting Flight for alleged interference in late stretch, lodged by the rider of Nelly Too.

ENTRY.NAME: Herecomes Scarlett
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ria Formosa
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,4p turn,evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Nelly Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail turn,in tight rail late

ENTRY.NAME: The Money Machine
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met 5/8,chased from 1/2,3& 4p turn,evenly lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lott's Creek Farm LLC & Christine K. Jones

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIZBO pressured the pace and took the nod approaching the quarter pole, contested the edge off the rail on the turn and dug in all out to just last. ROAD PARTY broke a step slow then picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out into the lane, dug in to take second the final strides and just missed. LION OF THE SEA gave chase, raced close in the four path on the turn and finished well. DAN THE MAN CAN gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and finished well. MARK DID IT gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the turn near the rail and finished well. HE IS BONAFIDE was hustled to the lead approaching the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, was met at the five sixteenths, raced close at the rail on the turn but flattened late stretch. HE'S ORIENTATE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. ATLANTIC VAQUERO gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path then flattened in the lane. ADDY'S LADDY T N T saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: He Is Bonafide
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead,met 5/16,close rail turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Road Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow,chased 7/16,off rail turn,up 2nd late,just missed

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Mark Did It
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CIDERHOUSE WAY settled in the three path the first turn, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and race in the four path on the far turn, dug in past the eighth pole and took the nod under the wire. SUMMONING DENIS rated a slim early lead inside, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement but was nipped under the wire. ALDARIGHTTRICKS rated close inside on the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. JUST CALL ME AL raced with the early pace two deep, challenged leaving the half mile pole but dropped back past the three eighths, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. MOON FALL rounded the first turn about the four path, left the turn outside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and weakened in the lane. SCARE DEM settled two deep on the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, gave chase passing the seven sixteenths pole, eased to the five path on the far turn and showed little further. I SEE NOTHING rounded the opening turn in the five path, picked up the chase past the half mile pole but dropped back toward the three eighths and weakened approaching the far turn. RED SPEAK PLEASE saved ground and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Summoning Denis
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured past 1/2,rail far turn,nipped wire
